text: My current office chair broke, and I bought this because it was on sale and I needed something asap. I knew that this chair was not a forever chair when I bought it but I have some pretty big concerns about the structural integrity of this chair.Ok, first the positive. It was easy to assemble, if not a bit cumbersome. If you’ve put together any furniture before then it’s fine. It’s only screws, nothing else. The back feels nice and lumbar support is decent.The negatives. As you can see in the photos, the base, arguably the most important part as far as sturdiness goes, has questionable welding at best. On each of the 5 legs the welding only goes about half way around leaving big gaps. Second, the quality of the weld where the wheels attach just looks like it’ll bend with any resistance. We’ll see though. Additionally, the entire back piece is just plastics, no metal involved at all. When you attach the back to the seat, even when you only slightly tighten the acres the plastic starts crumbling away. I fear that with continued pressure the screws will wear through the plastic. The seat is almost definitely made of particle board and over tightening the screws will likely crack it. The cushioning leaves much to be desired. Next, the arm rests are way too low, if you are tall they are basically useless. At least you can raise them, but seeing as how they are a part of the back, you cannot remove them. Finally, once it is all been assembled, the chair does not seem sturdy and has a bit of a side to side wobble. I am below the posted weight limit of 300 lbs, so there is no reason this chair should give out on me but, I’m concerned.Overall, if you are looking for a chair and you can spend a little more, then you absolutely should do that. I would not recommend this chair at all.I’ll update this as I use it, as I highly suspect something will give out sooner rather than later.

text: Ergonomic Office ChairSetup:The product is very easy to set up and takes around 20-30 minutes. I found the video instructions on the product listing to be infinitely useful, and it is how I assembled the chair.Style:The chair has a very good style and appearance. It looks like something you would find in a very modern office setting.Functionality:I use a 59” computer monitor and use a kitchen table for a desk. This product allows me to fold up the arms so I can really scoot into the table. This is one of my favorite features.The chair has about 5 inches of vertical movement that is set with a lever on the right-hand side. This is sufficient for me. This lever can also lock the seat in place so it doesn’t lean back.The chair also has a knob on the bottom front to adjust how easy it is to lean back. This chair has a tendency to keep you upright and it is a good position to be productive, but it’s really not the position I like to be when I am browsing or doing unproductive stuff.Even on the loosest setting, the chair doesn’t lean back very easily. For the leaner, you usually scoot your bottom near the front of the seat to get a good lean in, but because of the design of this chair, it wants to push you upright again. That’s just physics. If you want to really get a good lean, you need to prop your legs up on a table or something else.Comfort:This chair has good lumbar support and it is probably one of the best I’ve seen in office chairs.The overall comfort of the chair isn’t very high. The padding on the seat and arms is pretty thin. If you’re the type that likes to lean on one arm of a chair, your elbow is going to get sore.The worst aspect of this chair is the thinness of the seat cushion. It feels comfortable at first, but after spending some time in the chair, your tailbone feels tired and sore. This is directly related to the amount of cushion on the seat. I ordered an additional seat cushion to see if this improves it.Construction:The construction of this chair is very good and strong. While looking at the product photos online, I was a little nervous that this would be a little on the chincy side. That is not the case and everything is sufficiently solid enough to handle the job. I predict that this chair will last a long time or regular use.Overall, because I like a lot more comfort in my office chairs, I will most likely be replacing this chair soon. If you are more of a sit upright and proper person, this might be the chair for you. Because of this I do not recommend this product.

text: I am officially in love with my new chair! It was easy to put together by myself in about 1 hour and 15 minutes from the time I opened the box to its completion, which included verifying all parts and reading the instructions before proceeding with assembly. Everything about it works as advertised and exceeds my expectations for this product. For reference, I am a 5’2” woman and this chair fits my body perfectly. I can actually sit all the way back in the chair with my feet flat on the floor and my arms resting comfortably on the armrests. I have no need for extra cushioning or pillows to prop me up or forward, which is very rare for me with most furniture. The fabric, padding, plastic, and other materials used in the chair are all comfortable to touch. The lumbar support is a nice feature, too. I bought this chair for multipurpose use as my sewing/art/craft/office/everything chair. It will function well for all of my purposes. I am pleased with my purchase and I expect to get many years of use out of this chair.
